basics.name: Miguel Pimentel
basics.label: Asst. Contract Administrator
basics.summary: Asst. Contract Administrator with more than 8 years experience in a wide range of infrastructure projects. Proficient in managing underground utilities and earthwork projects. Additionally, I have experience in rehabilitating and reconstructing public facilities.

work.name: Metropolitan Council
work.summary: Administer construction contracts ensuring that budget, quality, and schedule goals are achieved…
highlights: Coordinate contract reviews and proposed changes, ensuring adherence to project schedules and costs.
Oversee projects through installation, construction, and commissioning phases, ensuring compliance with contract specifications.
Identify potential impacts on project timelines or expenses and implement measures to mitigate risks.
Manage contract processes, including proposals, evaluations, preparation, and negotiations.
Monitor procurement, construction, and facility service contracts, managing budgets and recommending revisions as needed.
Coordinate with regulatory agencies, governmental units, and other stakeholders.
Participate in contract negotiations, evaluate proposals, and ensure consulting engineers' compliance.
Assist in-house design preparation, create procurement process documents, and handle change order estimates and negotiations.

work.name: City of Bloomington
work.summary: Provide manual and technical field and office work in infrastructure design and inspection, traffic and transportation, water resources, property services, data management and GIS under supervision. Work includes a variety of tasks including drafting plans, cost estimates, surveying, inspection, and data management.
highlights: Inspected, managed, and coordinated public infrastructure projects.
Prepared and produced daily reports and summaries of work performed.
Designed and drafted plans for residential roads and bike trails.
Performed quantity tracking and analysis for construction activities.

work.name: City of Minneapolis
work.position: Engineering Technician III - Chief Field Inspector
work.summary: Perform specialized high level technical support and design work, act a liaison with other parties for the Professional Engineer in the field, and act as lead worker on a field crew performing construction inspection.
highlights: Acted as liaison between other city departments, residents, and contractors.
Kept a record of daily activities and work performed.
Prepared and hosted weekly progress report meetings.
Kept a record of daily activities and work performed.
SSampled and tested construction materials, incl. Asphalt, Concrete, and Soils.

work.name: Ingenieros Asociados-Construcciones
highlights: Regularly conducted site visits to verify compliance with construction plans.
Assisted with survey, design, planning, and construction of water and sewage systems.

projects.name: City of Bloomington Pavement Management Program
projects.summary: Design and inspection of resurfacing of residential roads and new bike trails.
highlights: Approx. cost: US$785,000

projects.name: Blue Line Intrusion Detection System Upgrade
projects.summary: New installation and demolition of the intrusion detection system, strobes, twc loops, wall mounted cabinets, electrical/communication conduits, junction boxes, and wiring.
highlights: Approx. cost: US$440,000

projects.name: Northtown Transit Center Reconstruction
projects.summary: Demolition and reconstruction of existing facility and surrounding parking lots. Installation of prefabricated bathroom, CCTV survaillance system, new street lighting.
highlights: Approx. cost: US$1,070,000

projects.name: Metro Transit Police Department Substation Rehab
projects.summary: Rehabilitation of previously public space into Metro Transit Police Department's newest substation in downtown Saint Paul.
highlights: Approx. cost: US$880,000
